did.unittitle: This Week and The Clubwomen's World magazine collection
did.abstract: This Week, later titled The Clubwomen's World, was a weekly women's magazine published in Brooklyn during the late 1920s and 1930s. Initially containing only social news relating to Brooklyn Heights, the magazine later expanded its coverage to include social news relating to additional Brooklyn neighborhoods, the activities of Brooklyn women's clubs, and the greater New York City area. This collection contains several issues of This Week and The Clubwomen's World spanning the period March 10, 1928 to March 25, 1933.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Since the early 19th century, New York City has been a major center for the publishing of women's magazines. Some of the earliest titles included Lady's Weekly Miscellany (1805-1808) and Ladies' Literary Cabinet (1819-1822). Later prominent titles published and edited in New York included Vogue (1892-), The Dilineator (1873-1937), Cosmopolitan (1886-), Good Housekeeping (1885-), and Ladies' Home Journal (1883-). While for many decades these publications contained articles relating to such issues as fashion, domestic life, and activities of the social elite, in the 1960s they also began to carry articles reflecting the dramatic changes upheaving women's conventional social roles. From the 1970s onward, women's magazines continued to flourish in New York City and covered an increasingly diverse range of issues.

This Week, later titled The Clubwomen's World, was a weekly women's magazine published in Brooklyn during the late 1920s and 1930s. Initially containing only social news relating to Brooklyn Heights, the magazine later expanded its coverage to include social news relating to additional Brooklyn neighborhoods, the activities of Brooklyn women's clubs, and the greater New York City area. The magazine was edited by Lee M. Pasquin and published by Gertrude Morrison Fisher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues of the Brooklyn weekly women's magazine, This Week, spanning the period March 10, 1928 to March 25, 1933. Issues dating from January 14, 1933 to March 25, 1933 carry the magazine's later name, The Clubwomen's World. The magazines contain social news relating to several Brooklyn neighborhoods and the greater New York City area, with a focus on the activities of various women's clubs. While the collection contains most issues of the magazine published during the aforementioned date range, a small number of issues are absent.
